general: This law allows the government to use money from the "Consolidated Fund" to pay for things like salaries, buildings, and other expenses for the financial year that ends on March 31st, 2001. It also says that the money given to the government in this session of parliament can be used for these purposes. Finally, it gets rid of some old laws that are no longer needed.

summary:
The Consolidated Fund (Appropriation) Act 2000 allows the government to spend money from the Consolidated Fund to cover the costs of running the country for the financial year ending on 31st March 2001. This includes paying for things like salaries, benefits, and other expenses. The act also repeals some old laws that are no longer needed.
In simpler terms, this law lets the government use money from a special fund called the Consolidated Fund to pay for things like salaries, benefits, and other expenses for the financial year ending on 31st March 2001. It also gets rid of some old laws that are no longer needed.
This law is important because it helps the government pay for the things it needs to run the country, like salaries and benefits for public workers. It also helps keep the government's finances organized by getting rid of old laws that are no longer needed.
